meanings.definition: Streaks of precipitation that evaporate before reaching the ground.
meanings.sent1: The virga in the sky looked like rain but never made it to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast mentioned virga, so we didn't expect any actual rain.
meanings.sent3: The virga played a trick on us, pretending to be rain but disappearing before landing.
meanings.sent4: The virga danced in the sky, teasing the earth with its fleeting presence.
meanings.sent5: The virga painted a temporary masterpiece in the air, only to vanish without a trace.

meanings.sent3: The virga flowers whispered secrets to the bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent4: The virga blossoms stood tall like colorful soldiers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Each virga plant seemed to have its own personality, brightening up the yard.

meanings.definition: A type of cloud formation resembling hanging wisps or streaks.
meanings.sent1: The sky was filled with virga clouds, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent2: We gazed up at the virga formation, marveling at its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The virga clouds seemed to be playing a game of tag in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeked through the virga clouds, casting a warm glow on the landscape.
